017package org.apache.juneau.utils;
018
019import java.util.function.*;
020
021/**
022 * Allows you to perform a function against 2 objects.
023 *
024 * <p>
025 * Same as {@link BiFunction}.
026 *
027 * <p class='bjava'>
028 *    Tuple2Function&lt;A,B,R&gt; <jv>x</jv> = (<jv>a</jv>,<jv>b</jv>) -&gt; <jsm>doSomething</jsm>(<jv>a</jv>,<jv>b</jv>);
029 *
030 *    R <jv>result</jv> = <jv>x</jv>.apply(<jv>xa</jv>,<jv>xb</jv>);
031 * </p>
032 *
033 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
034 * </ul>
035 *
036 * @param <A> Object 1 type.
037 * @param <B> Object 2 type.
038 * @param <R> Result type.
039 */
040@FunctionalInterface
041public interface Tuple2Function<A,B,R> {
042
043   @SuppressWarnings("javadoc")
044   R apply(A a, B b);
045
046   @SuppressWarnings("javadoc")
047   default <V> Tuple2Function<A,B,V> andThen(Function<? super R, ? extends V> after) {
048      return (A a, B b) -> after.apply(apply(a, b));
049   }
050}
